episodes.title: Ruby Franke’s Daughter Shari Franke Speaks Out About Alleged Abuse
episodes.description:
Ruby Franke’s eldest daughter, Shari Franke, is speaking out for the first time about the alleged abuse she claims her mom inflicted on her as a child. She told her side of the story in her memoir, “The House Of My Mother: A Daughter’s Quest For Freedom” and stopped by “Good Morning America” on Jan. 7, to discuss some of the alleged abuse. "When I was younger, around, like, five-six, Ruby was really physical,” she said. “Whether it was like a slap to the lip or-- a slap to the cheek…when I would practice the piano, her hand would slam and it was really scary. And honestly, when she met Jodi [Hildebrandt], that kind of stopped." Jodi Hildebrandt was a Mormon family counselor and mentor to Ruby. Shari told “GMA” she felt a shift when Jodi came into the picture. Ruby is a former YouTuber who rose to fame by sharing videos of her family life in Utah, even offering parenting advice, that was sometimes controversial. In August 2023 she was arrested along Jodi after authorities found an emaciated and malnourished juvenile with open wounds and duct tape on their extremities. That December, the former vlogger pleaded guilty to four counts of child abuse.

0:00 - Introduction of Shari Franke
0:36 - Childhood Experiences and Allegations
1:20 - Impact of Jodi Hildebrandt's Influence
2:05 - Context of Ruby Franke's Arrest
3:13 - Conclusion and Reflection

episodes.title: Bethany Joy Lenz Reveals How She GOT OUT OF CULT
episodes.description:
Bethany Joy Lenz is sharing her story. The "One Tree Hill" actress sat down with Access Hollywood guest correspondent Emily Orozco to discuss her new memoir, "Dinner for Vampires: Life on a Cult TV Show (While Also in an Actual Cult!)” and detailed her experience getting involved with and breaking away from a cult during her time on acting on her hit WB series. "Dinner for Vampires: Life on a Cult TV Show (While Also in an Actual Cult!)" is out now.

episodes.title: Stars Who Have Been Reportedly Linked To CULTS
episodes.description:
Netflix’s wild new docuseries “Dancing for the Devil: The 7M TikTok Cult” is uncovering the story of TikTok dancers who are allegedly trapped in a cult masquerading as a management company called 7M. The show’s popularity has increased public interest in cults—which Meriam-Webster defines as a group of people who practice great devotion to a person, idea, object, or work. From Bethany Joy Lenz to Joaquin Phoenix and Michelle Pfeiffer, Access Hollywood is breaking down the celebrities who have been reportedly linked to cults and uncovering what they’ve said about their alleged experiences over the years.

episodes.title: Dancing for the Devil: Melanie Wilking RESPONDS TO Miranda Derrick's Statement (EXCLUSIVE)
episodes.description:
The new docuseries "Dancing for the Devil: The 7M TikTok Cult," which quickly hit No. 1 on Netflix, uncovers the story of TikTok dancers allegedly trapped in a cult masquerading as a management company called 7M headed by leader Robert Shinn. Melanie Wilking spoke with Access Hollywood's Zuri Hall to share her story and speak out about her sister Miranda Derrick. During the in-depth interview, Melanie revealed when she noticed something shifted for her sister and responded to her sister’s claims about her family. She also revealed where her relationship with Miranda stands now that the documentary has been released and shared a special message to her. “I would want her to watch the documentary because from the statement that she put it out it is very obvious that she did not. And so, I would want her to watch because it is so much deeper than just our family,” she said. “Just educate yourself and know that we absolutely love you with all of our heart.” Access Hollywood has reached out to Shinn –who is 7M's CEO and Shekinah Church's founder – for comment. He has previously denied all allegations against him, including that 7M is a cult. "Dancing for the Devil" is out now on Netflix.

episodes.title: 'Dancing for the Devil: The 7M TikTok Cult': Kylie Douglas Speaks Out
episodes.description:
The new docuseries "Dancing for the Devil: The 7M TikTok Cult," which quickly hit No. 1 on Netflix, uncovers the story of TikTok dancers allegedly trapped in a cult masquerading as a management company called 7M headed by leader Robert Shinn. Kylie Douglas, one of the dancers featured in the series, sat down exclusively with Access Hollywood's Zuri Hall to share her story. Access Hollywood has reached out to Shinn –who is 7M's CEO and Shekinah Church's founder – for comment.  He has previously denied all allegations against him, including that 7M is a cult. "Dancing for the Devil" is out now on Netflix. Tune in to see Kylie's interview and more on the docuseries on "Access Hollywood" on June 3 and 4.

episodes.title: Bethany Joy Lenz Gets Honest About Cult Experience
episodes.description: Bethany Joy Lenz is sharing her truth. During a wide-ranging sit-down interview with Access Hollywood's Zuri Hall, the "One Tree Hill" alum got candid about her experience of being in a cult and explained why she didn't speak out until now, sharing, "I think anytime we go through trauma there's always shame attached to it and you're not sure about how people are going to perceive you and you don't want to be categorized and lumped in as like oh the girl who was in a cult … so that's now what I am every time I walk into a room, I don't want that, I'm so much more than that, but I think that happens to so many of us because of so many different things in our lives. People just like to put labels and categories on everyone and so that was a big part of it just feeling like I don't know how to talk about this where I feel like I'll be really understood and I was kind of terrified of being misunderstood." Bethany also talked about her new single "Strawberries" and revealed the inspiration behind the track, which is available to stream Aug. 18.
